overview.short: Cardiobacterium valvarum is a fastidious Gram-negative, facultatively anaerobic rod within the HACEK group, associated with infective endocarditis.
overview.clinical_context: Typically recovered from blood cultures in endocarditis; may be under-recognized without MALDI-TOF or molecular identification.

species_markers.notes: Indole may be less consistently positive than in C. hominis; species-level calls are best confirmed by MALDI-TOF or sequencing.
Supports Cardiobacterium genus placement among fastidious Gram-negative rods.
In an endocarditis context, HACEK-like slow growth with matching biochemistry increases plausibility.

common_confusions.reason: Overlapping biochemical pattern; indole may be the only weak differentiator and is not fully reliable.
Similar endocarditis association and fastidious growth; requires confident genus discrimination.

when_to_question_identification: Strong lactose fermentation or broad sugar positivity (not typical).
Fast growth on non-enriched media without prolonged incubation.

recommended_next_tests.reason: May help trend toward C. hominis vs C. valvarum, but not definitive.
Preferred approach to separate Cardiobacterium species reliably.
Most definitive route for species-level confirmation when required clinically.
